title: Diabetes Assistance Programs for Uninsured Families

introduction.heading: 💙 Help is Available
introduction.content: If you're managing diabetes without insurance, you're not alone. Many manufacturers and organizations offer assistance programs to help reduce the cost of insulin, CGMs, pumps, and supplies. This guide compiles verified programs to help you find the support you need.

insulin_manufacturers.title: 💉 Insulin Assistance Programs
insulin_manufacturers.description: Major insulin manufacturers offer programs that can reduce insulin costs to $35/month or even free for qualifying patients.

programs.description: Monthly cap of $35 for most Lilly insulins for people without insurance or with high-deductible plans.
programs.eligibility: Available to people without insurance or with commercial insurance with high out-of-pocket costs
programs.how_to_apply: Download savings card from website or ask your pharmacy

programs.description: Free insulin for qualifying patients who cannot afford their medication.
programs.eligibility: Household income at or below 300% of Federal Poverty Level
programs.how_to_apply: Complete application online or download forms

programs.description: Free insulin for eligible patients without insurance coverage.
programs.eligibility: Household income at or below 400% of Federal Poverty Level, no insurance coverage for medication

programs.description: $99 for a 30-day supply of insulin for people without insurance.
programs.eligibility: People without insurance or whose insurance doesn't cover insulin

programs.description: Reduced-cost insulin program for people without insurance.
programs.eligibility: People without insurance or with high out-of-pocket costs
programs.how_to_apply: Download savings card or register online

cgm_manufacturers.title: 📱 CGM Assistance Programs
cgm_manufacturers.description: Continuous glucose monitor companies provide programs to help with device and sensor costs.

programs.description: Financial assistance for Dexcom CGM systems and supplies.
programs.eligibility: Financial need, no insurance or inadequate coverage
programs.how_to_apply: Contact Dexcom customer service for application

programs.description: Assistance programs for FreeStyle Libre systems.
programs.eligibility: Varies by program, financial need assessment

programs.description: Financial assistance for Medtronic diabetes products.

pump_manufacturers.title: ⚡ Insulin Pump Assistance
pump_manufacturers.description: Pump manufacturers offer financing, loaner programs, and assistance for qualifying patients.

programs.description: Financial assistance and payment plans for t:slim X2 insulin pumps.
Coverage support and financial assistance for Omnipod systems.
Financial assistance and insurance support for MiniMed pumps.

supply_companies.title: 📦 Supply Discount Programs
supply_companies.description: Diabetes supply companies offer discounted rates for uninsured patients on test strips, lancets, and other supplies.

programs.description: Discounted diabetes supplies for uninsured customers.
programs.how_to_apply: Call customer service or shop online

programs.description: Discounted diabetes supplies for cash-paying customers.
programs.eligibility: All customers, additional discounts for uninsured

programs.description: Special pricing for uninsured diabetes patients.

additional_resources.title: 🔗 Additional Resources
additional_resources.description: Other organizations and programs that can help reduce diabetes-related costs.

programs.description: Prescription discount program that can reduce insulin and medication costs.
programs.eligibility: Available to everyone, no insurance required
programs.how_to_apply: Download app or print coupons from website

programs.description: Comprehensive database of patient assistance programs and discount cards.
programs.how_to_apply: Search database by medication or condition

programs.description: Helps patients find assistance programs for their medications.
Copay assistance for Type 1 Diabetes medications and supplies.
programs.eligibility: Insurance coverage with high out-of-pocket costs, income limits apply
programs.how_to_apply: Apply online when funds are available

programs.description: Financial assistance for diabetes medications and supplies.
programs.eligibility: Insurance coverage with high costs, income at or below 500% FPL
programs.how_to_apply: Apply online when funds are open

quick_tips: Start with manufacturer programs - they often have the most generous assistance
Don't be discouraged if you don't qualify for one program - try others
Keep documentation of your income and medical needs ready
Many programs can be combined with discount cards like GoodRx
Call customer service - they often know about programs not listed online
Ask your endocrinologist's office - they often have samples and program information
Check if your state has additional assistance programs
Some programs have waiting lists - apply early and follow up
emergency_resources: For immediate insulin needs: Contact manufacturer patient assistance hotlines
For supplies: Check local diabetes support groups and endocrinologist offices for samples
For CGMs: Many companies offer trial programs or starter kits
Visit local health departments - some have emergency medication programs
Check with local pharmacies - some have their own assistance programs
application_tips: Gather income documentation (tax returns, pay stubs)
Get a letter from your doctor about medical necessity
Be persistent - follow up on applications
Apply to multiple programs - you can often combine benefits
Keep copies of all applications and correspondence
